resources.string: Which letter is this hand sign?
Which word are these hand signs?
There are many sign language alphabets. The swedish sign alphabet was created in 1808 for schooling the deaf. Its creator, PerAron Borg, also opened the first swedish school for the deaf.
Welcome to Swedish Sign Alphabet help! The first thing you should do is select the New Player button. New Game and Settings will remain disabled until you create a player profile and login.
In our example you can see the player Jill already exists, but if this is a new installation, there will be no players in the list. You will need to select the Create New Player button.

Here you should select the username field and enter a name. It must be at least three letters long. You may also choose a picture with the Choose Picture button, otherwise you are assigned a default picture.
Here you choose the picture you would like to have as your avatar. When you are finished, you will automatically be returned to the previous screen.
Now that you have a valid name and a picture it is time to select the Create New Player button. This will take you back to the login screen.
Now you should see your newly created username in the list. Click on and your name will appear at the top of the screen and the login button will active. You always log in from this screen.
Back in the main menu we see that the New Game and Game Settings buttons have activated. Click on the New Game button to come to the next screen where you may choose difficulty and number of letters.

Difficulty is chosen with the radio buttons. One allows approximately 10 seconds, two allows 5 seconds, and three allows 2 seconds to answer, all with greater rewards. Click on a number of letters to start.
The game starts asking you to guess the letter or word presented. The bar at the bottom is your time ticking away. The three buttons with letters are your alternatives. Press one to choose.
Here we answered before time ran out. The green colour, and pleasant noise mean a correct answer. See that points and total points have increased, and the next button is now enabled.
In this example we answered incorrectly. The red colour, and unpleasant buzz noise mean a wrong answer. Points will not increase. We can press the next button to try again.
In this example the ticking stopped and an awful beep noise occured. Time ran out. We were still able to guess correctly after time ran out, but we gain no points for it.
Here is an example of a game with three letters. Note there are three sign pictures, and each answer button has three letters.

After 10 guesses, the game ends. You learn how many you answered right, how fast you answered on average, your total score (not pictured) and if it was a new high score for you or not. If it was, you gain applause.
If you click the high score button from the end of the game, or from the main menu, you can view the high score list. Here we see the high scores of both Jill and Anders.
And this is the sound settings screen. It can be reached through Game Setings from the Main Menu. Here you can turn sound and vibrations on and off, and adjust volume. We hope this guide helped you!
